hints_html:
The second shifting theorem states \(\mathcal{L}( u(t-a) f(t-a)) = e^{-as} F(s)\), where \(u\) denotes the heaviside function. You need to recognize a function \(f\) so that

\[\begin{aligned} \displaystyle g(t) = u(t-a) f(t-a)\end{aligned}\]
hints_raw:
The second shifting theorem states <math>\mathcal{L}( u(t-a) f(t-a)) = e^{-as} F(s)</math>, where <math>u</math> denotes the heaviside function. You need to recognize a function &fnof; so that 
:<math>\displaystyle g(t) = u(t-a) f(t-a)</math>
question: 4 (a)
sols_html:
We will use the fact that \(\mathcal{L}(u(t-a) f(t-a)) = e^{-as} F(s)\).

We recognize that

\[\begin{aligned} \displaystyle g(t) = u(t-1) e^{t-1} = u(t-1) f(t-1)\end{aligned}\]

where \(\displaystyle f(t) = e^t\). Thus,

\[\begin{aligned} \mathcal{L}(g(t)) = e^{-s} \mathcal{L}(e^t) = \frac{e^{-s}}{s-1}\end{aligned}\]
sols_raw:
We will use the fact that <math>\mathcal{L}(u(t-a) f(t-a)) = e^{-as} F(s)</math>.

We recognize that

:<math>\displaystyle g(t) = u(t-1) e^{t-1} = u(t-1) f(t-1)</math>

where <math>\displaystyle f(t) = e^t</math>. Thus,

:<math>\mathcal{L}(g(t)) = e^{-s} \mathcal{L}(e^t) = \frac{e^{-s}}{s-1}</math>
statement_html:
Find the Laplace transform of the following piecewise continuous function by either using the definition of Laplace transform or the second shifting theorem involving a unit step function.

:g(t) = \begin{cases} 0, \quad t < 1 \\ e^{t-1}, \quad t \geq 1 \end{cases}
statement_latex:
Find the Laplace transform of the following piecewise continuous
function by either using the definition of Laplace transform or the
second shifting theorem involving a unit step function.

:g(t) = \textbackslash{}begin\{cases\} 0, \textbackslash{}quad t
\textless{} 1 \textbackslash{}\textbackslash{} e\^{}\{t-1\},
\textbackslash{}quad t \textbackslash{}geq 1
\textbackslash{}end\{cases\}
statement_raw:
Find the Laplace transform of the following piecewise continuous function by either using the definition of Laplace transform or the second shifting theorem involving a unit step function.

:<math>g(t) = \begin{cases} 0, \quad t < 1 \\ e^{t-1}, \quad t \geq 1 \end{cases}
